verbose_text: alphaKG has emerged as master regulatory metabolite in aging biology as it is a key TCA intermediate, a cofactor for numerous transamination reactions, [60, 61] a cofactor for the prolyl hydroxylase dependent hydroxylation of the transcription factor hypoxia inducible factor-1 (HIF-1) [62, 63, 64] and a cofactor for epigenetic enzymes, histone, and DNA demethylases.
evidence: prolyl hydroxylase dependent hydroxylation of the transcription factor hypoxia inducible factor-1
